content.description: This begins on the right-facing flake above the ledge.  The crux is at the last protection bolt.
content.protection: Six bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with biners.
content.location:
This is the second route from the right, left of

Pump and Run

.

content.description:
This is a traditional line that is not in the guidebook(s).  Start in the prominent alcove/corner 50 feet left of

Corner Market

. An awkward, dirty start in a steep, licheness corner (8ish) eventually leads to a short but clean, steep, exciting finish on small/thin protection.  It has a gear belay and walkoff. The good climbing is pretty short. It gets a 1/2 star for a nice steep finish, the route narrowly avoids bomb rating.  It is maybe worth doing...maybe. Currently it is a bit loose.
content.location:
This is 50 feet left of

Corner Market

. It climbs a prominent alcove/corner. Currently, it is the furthest left route at the crag.

content.description: From the ledge, follow a thin seam to a bulge, climb through and encounter the crux.
content.protection: Six bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
[This is three] routes right of

Corner Market

, one route right of

Kwik-E-Mart

.

content.description: Pump and Run is sustained and pumpy!
content.location: This is the farthest route to the right.

content.description: This route begins on the small, left-facing flake. The crux is near the top.
content.protection: Six bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with biners.
content.location:
This is right of the 5.7 crack climb,

Corner Market

. It is left of

Self Serve

.

content.description:
This route shares the first 3 bolts with

Five and Dime

to establish the ledge. From the ledge, you climb a very fun, leftward traverse for 3 bolts. Shake out and chalk up mid-route to get ready for the finish, which climbs through beautiful crimps and sidepulls with a big move to a dinner plate hold to clip the anchors. This route is sustained and fun!
content.location:
This is to the right of

Breaking the Mold

.

content.description: A short, vertical face with three bolts leads to an interesting, left-leaning dike and a steep, exposed finish with four bolts.
content.location:
This is left of the crack climb,

Corner Market

.

content.description: Follow the obvious crack system in the center of the face.
content.protection: A light, standard rack is sufficient protection to reach the fixed anchors with slings and a link.

climbs.name: Breaking the Mold
climbs.fa: bolted By John Garlough, Kevin Capps and Jay Samuelson. FA Kevin Capps
